description: Monitor your Algorand node with host and algod metrics. Contains: algod, CPU, memory, disk, IO, network, temperature and other monitoring indicators.

panels.description: Get the largest partition by the variable maxmount.
panels.title: Maximum partition ($maxmount) usage

panels.description:
Node_disk_io_time_seconds_total:
The number of milliseconds the disk spends on input/output operations. This value is the accumulated value. (Milliseconds Spent Doing I/Os)

Irate(node_disk_io_time_seconds_total[1m]):
Calculate the rate per second: (last value - last previous value) / timestamp difference, that is: the percentage of time that the disk spends on I/O operations in 1 second.
panels.title: CPU usage, disk I/O operations per second (%)

panels.description:
Reads completed: 每个磁盘分区每秒读完成次数

Writes completed: 每个磁盘分区每秒写完成次数

IO now 每Reads completed: Reads per second for each disk partition

Writes completed: Write completions per second for each disk partition

IO now The number of input/output requests being processed per second per disk partition个磁盘分区每秒正在处理的输入/输出请求数
panels.title: Disk read and write rate（IOPS）

panels.description:
Read bytes The number of bits read per second per disk partition
Written bytes The number of bits written per second per disk partition
panels.title: Disk read and write capacity

panels.description:
Read time ms The number of seconds per disk partition read operation

Write time ms The number of seconds per disk partition write operation

IO time ms Number of seconds spent per disk partition input/output operation

IO time weighted Weighted seconds spent per disk partition input/output operation
panels.title: Disk IO read and write time

panels.description:
CurrEstab - number of TCP connections with current state of ESTABLISHED or CLOSE-WAIT

ActiveOpens - TCP average connections that have been converted from the CLOSED state to the SYN-SENT state (within 1 minute)

PassiveOpens - TCP average connections that have been converted from the LISTEN state to the SYN-RCVD state (within 1 minute)

TCP_alloc - the number of TCP sockets that have been allocated (established, applied to sk_buff)

TCP_inuse - the number of TCP sockets being used (listening)

TCP_tw - number of TCP connections waiting to be closed
panels.title: TCP Connection situation

title: Algorand Node Monitoring
